content.description: SDS. Squeeze a horizontal pitch with left hand and bear down on a small right hand crimp. set left foot in a small left triangular corner and right foot on the corner of a block. Pull off the pad, then lunge for the lip about 3 feet up. It's one just one move to the lip that might require some meditation. Once you latch the lip, match and mantle to stand under The Throne.
content.protection: A thin pad and large pad work well. Since it's a sloped start, some pad surfing might happen.

content.description: Climb the stairs up to the obvious throne, on the right. Finish by sitting in the throne.... You're not worthy.
content.protection: Lots of pads, lots of spotters, and some properly aligned Chakras.

content.description: Start on the low rail at at the base of the stairs. Work up with a couple of pinches, into a series of underclings. One tiny crimp guards the top jug. Can you keep your center long enough to catch the top?
content.location: straight up the middle bulge, right at the base of the stairs.

content.description: SDS. Match on the sharp lip of the monkey's face, then reach up to the sloping cheekbone. Climb up the head to the big jug about 4 feet above the Screeching Monkey's head. SDS starting with the cheekbone is about V2.
content.protection: 2 pads. A smaller one is helpful between the rock and a tree
content.location: Facing the main Hidden Temple area, take the trail downhill along the wall. Pass over a large root/tree in the trail and the Screeching Monkey is in your face!

content.description: This is a variation of Dunk Like a Monk. SDS. From the start holds, lunge right to a good pinch. Set your feet and go to the lip. More of a layup than a dunk! Climb up to stand under The Throne.
content.protection: At least one big pad recommended. Brushing off the top out is helpful.
content.location: Same start as Dunk Like a Monk.

content.description: SDS. Match the sharp lip of the monkey's face, then go right to climb the short face then move left to finish on the big jug above the Screeching Monkey! Expect a high gravity start in the planet of the apes!
content.protection: 2 pads. A smaller one is helpful between the rock and the tree.
content.location: Facing the main Hidden Temple area, take the trail downhill along the wall. Pass over the large root/tree in the trail and the Screeching Monkey is there!

content.description: SDS. Start with left hand on small crimp and right hand on an even smaller edge. Place the right foot on the best hold on the slanted rock under the overhang. Fire the right hand to the top lip, about 3 feet up. Match hands and work your feet up to stand under The Throne.
content.protection: A thin pad and large pad. The landing is sloped, so readjustment might be needed.
content.location: Just left of Thunk Like a Monk the right starting hold is the same as the left starting hold for Dunk Like a Monk.

content.description: Start far left. Tension start on the big undercling, then traverse right. Stay low on the good crimp rail or go high to the noticeable side-pull. Easy mantel to the finish. Great spot to stop and meditate on life's great mysteries.

Sit Down Start on The Seven Chakras and go left to the upper face of Blue Barracudas and finish on the mantle. There is a loose, thin pinch block on The Seven Chakras. If you can't send The Seven Chakras, sing the blues with this sweet one!
Sit Start on a low ledge, dead center. Follow the line of small ledges straight up to a breezy mantle. Blue Barracudas, everyone remembers that 90's show, right?
content.location: Dead center, just to the left of 7 Chakras.

content.description: Ascend straight up the face on the left side. follow a crack up to a big move to a big ledge. At this point you are pretty much right next to the main ledge so just step on over to your right and your done. Hope those wasps don't decide to come back this year.....
content.protection: Several pads, multiple spotters, and a real drive to see the light.
content.location: Left hand side of the temple.

content.description: Hidden up in the trees, you will find a temple of orange rock. Slabby face climbs lead to a large ledge to top out on. Capped by a big roof. Do you have what it takes to sit atop the throne??
